greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Period 6: repeat [0, 0, 1, 0, 1, 1].
comment: all runs have length <= 2, cf. A130658;

This is the lexicographically earliest extensible binary sequence containing no palindromes of length 5 or more. It is impossible to avoid palindromes of length 4 in a binary sequence. Two zeros could be added at the beginning and still have no longer palindrome, but then it would be impossible to extend the sequence further back without creating a longer palindrome. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Nov 24 2013
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1).
formula: a(n) = mod(n-1, 1 + mod(n, 3)). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Aug 16 2014
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 06 2012
ext: Title changed by _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Nov 24 2013
